macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Tests $72,500 Low Amid Wall Street Sell-Off
items.summary: Bitcoin dropped sharply to around $72,500, its lowest since early November 2024, while Ethereum fell 10% to $2,100, extending losses amid U.S. tech sector panic and Nasdaq decline.

items.title: Crypto Market Cap Drops 12% to $2.7 Trillion in Weekend Sell-Off
items.summary: The total cryptocurrency market capitalization declined by about 12% to US$2.7 trillion following a weekend sell-off.

items.title: Over $638 Million in Token Unlocks Scheduled for Early February
items.summary: Major token unlocks worth more than $638 million are set for the first week of February 2026, led by Hyperliquid (HYPE) on February 6, XDC Network (XDC) on February 5, and Berachain (BERA) on February 6, potentially causing market volatility.

items.title: U.S. Senate Crypto Market Structure Bill Passes Markup Vote
items.summary: The U.S. Senate's crypto market structure bill successfully passed a markup vote, marking a key regulatory development.

items.title: 89% of Family Offices Hold No Crypto Assets Despite Hype
items.summary: JPMorgan Private Bank's 2026 Global Family Office Report reveals that 89% of global family offices do not hold cryptocurrency, citing volatility and inconsistent correlations with other assets.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Universal Robots Unveils 4 Key Physical AI Predictions for 2026
items.summary: Universal Robots predicts that in 2026, collaborative robots (cobots) will become commonplace in workplaces, enabling faster skill acquisition through intelligent sensors, self-correction, and adaptive control, revolutionizing automation and human-machine cooperation.

items.title: SAIR Launches AI for Science: Kick-Off 2026 Event
items.summary: SAIR formally begins its public initiatives with AI for Science: Kickoff 2026, focusing on advancing scientific discovery through artificial intelligence.

items.title: AI and Predictive Analytics Set to Transform EMS, Fire, and Healthcare in 2026
items.summary: AI is poised to streamline workflows in emergency medical services, fire departments, and healthcare by reducing paperwork, enhancing data interoperability, and enabling proactive care models like syndromic surveillance.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: GTA 6 Delay Fears Rise Ahead of Take-Two's February 3 Earnings Call
items.summary: Rockstar Games' silence on GTA 6 has fueled speculation of a potential delay beyond its November 2026 release, with fans awaiting updates during Take-Two Interactive's earnings call on February 3, 2026.

items.title: Starbreeze Announces New Wave of Layoffs at Payday Developer
items.summary: Starbreeze Studios, developer of Payday, is pushing ahead with another round of layoffs amid ongoing industry challenges.

items.title: Moonshot Games Confirms Layoffs for Wildgate Developer
items.summary: Moonshot Games has confirmed layoffs affecting its team developing the upcoming title Wildgate.

items.title: Ubisoft Initiates Major Studio Restructure and Layoffs
items.summary: Ubisoft is undergoing a colossal restructure, including significant changes to its studio ecosystem and layoffs.

items.title: EB Games to Close All New Zealand Stores, Owned by GameStop
items.summary: GameStop-owned EB Games plans to shut down all its stores in New Zealand, impacting retail presence in the region.

items.title: RuneScape Surpasses $3 Billion in Lifetime Revenue
items.summary: The long-running MMORPG RuneScape has topped $3 billion in total lifetime revenue, highlighting its enduring success.

items.title: Netflix Prioritizes Cloud-Based TV Games in 2026
items.summary: Netflix's boss states that cloud-based games for TV will be a major priority for the company in 2026.

items.title: Congress Raises Concerns Over Potential Saudi-Led EA Buyout
items.summary: U.S. Congress members express serious concerns regarding a possible Saudi-led acquisition of Electronic Arts.

items.title: Xbox Hardware Revenue Drops 32% in Q2
items.summary: Microsoft reports a 32% decline in Xbox hardware revenue for the second quarter.

items.title: Helldivers 2 Reveals New 'Force of Law' Warbond
items.summary: Helldivers 2 announces the upcoming Force of Law Warbond, adding new content to the cooperative shooter.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Apple Studio Display 2 on Track for 2026 Launch with mini-LED and ProMotion
items.summary: Apple is targeting a refresh of its Studio Display in the first half of 2026, featuring mini-LED and ProMotion technologies, as indicated by dwindling inventory and extended shipping times for the current model.

items.title: Samsung Galaxy Buds 4 to Address Reliability Issues from Buds 3
items.summary: Samsung plans to unveil Galaxy Buds 4 and Buds 4 Pro alongside the Galaxy S26 at Galaxy Unpacked 2026 next month, focusing on improved build quality and practicality to fix controversies with the previous Buds 3 models.

items.title: SpaceX Plans Falcon 9 Launch with 29 Starlink Satellites
items.summary: SpaceX is scheduled to launch a Falcon 9 rocket from Cape Canaveral Space Force Station on February 4, carrying 29 Starlink satellites.

items.title: Microsoft Ending Some Standalone OneDrive and SharePoint Plans
items.summary: Microsoft is discontinuing certain popular standalone OneDrive and SharePoint plans due to lack of profitability.

items.title: Windows 11 Bug Breaks Desktop for Some Users, Fix Available
items.summary: A Windows 11 bug is causing the entire desktop to break for some users, but a fix has been identified.

items.title: Two New Affordable DJI Drones Leak, Potentially Evading US Ban
items.summary: Leaks reveal two new budget-friendly DJI drones that may avoid the US ban.

items.title: India Offers Zero Taxes to Foreign Cloud Providers Using Local Data Centers Until 2047
items.summary: India is providing tax incentives to foreign cloud providers until 2047, conditional on routing data through Indian data centers.

items.title: iPhone Users Gain New Privacy Feature in iOS 26.3
items.summary: iOS 26.3 introduces a new feature enhancing user privacy for iPhone owners.

items.title: Sony Patents Touchscreen Controller for Improved Accessibility
items.summary: Sony's new patent for a touchscreen game controller could advance accessibility with configurable designs.

items.title: Trump Extends TikTok Deadline Again Amid Trade Talks
items.summary: The US has granted a third 90-day extension on TikTok enforcement as Beijing leverages the app in trade negotiations.
